snippet: Militants stormed the grounds of a university in Ramadi, briefly holding some students hostage, officials said.
abstract: Sunni militants carrying banner of Islamic State in Iraq and Syria attack a university in the western city of Ramadi in third day of surging violence in Iraq; in capital of Baghdad, at least 48 people are killed by car bombs in apparently coordinated series of explosions.

byline.contributor: Employees of The New York Times contributed reporting from Baghdad and Ramadi, Iraq.

lead_paragraph: Militants stormed the grounds of a university in Ramadi, briefly holding some students hostage, officials said.

headline.main: Across Iraq, Insurgents Show Reach in Attacks
headline.print_headline: Across Iraq, Insurgents Show Reach in Attacks

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
